# Draft:Sandeep Adhwaryu

Sandeep Adhwaryu (born 22 December) is an Indian political and editorial cartoonist, currently serving as the Chief Cartoonist for The Times of India. He is widely known for his sharp political satire and visual commentary on Indian social and political issues.
Early life and education
Sandeep Adhwaryu was born in Sagar, in the Indian state of Madhya Pradesh. According to his official Facebook page, his birthdate is 22 December. He completed his schooling at Kendriya Vidyalaya, Sagar, and pursued higher education at Dr. Harisingh Gour University (formerly Sagar University).
Career
Adhwaryu began his career as an editorial cartoonist with Outlook magazine in the early 2000s, where his political cartoons gained national attention.
He later worked with several publications before joining The Times of India as its Chief Cartoonist:
* Mail Today – Editorial Cartoonist
* The Sunday Guardian – Editorial Cartoonist
At The Times of India, Adhwaryu regularly produces a cartoon series titled Line of No Control, a recurring strip published on the TOI cartoons pages and promoted on TOI’s social media. The series addresses current political and social issues through two- and four-panel cartoons and has appeared frequently since 2016.
His cartoons are recognised for their simplicity of line and depth of message, often critiquing political establishments, social apathy, and media hypocrisy. He frequently shares his work on social media, where his cartoons generate wide discussion.
Adhwaryu’s work combines satire with symbolic minimalism. His recurring themes include political corruption, gender inequality, communal tension, and public indifference.
In addition to his newspaper work, Adhwaryu illustrated the book The India I Love by Ruskin Bond (2004), published by Rupa Publications, where his illustrations complemented the prose and poems in the book.
Events and appearances
Adhwaryu took part in cultural events hosted by foreign missions in New Delhi, including the launch of Tintin comics at the Belgium Embassy. He also featured in a talk promoted by the Embassy of Switzerland in New Delhi on the “Power of Cartoons” as part of the Francophonie Week / 70 Years of Swiss-Indian Friendship events.
His cartoons and commentary have been referenced in discussions related to literary festivals such as the Jaipur Literature Festival; his work has been cited in media pieces covering the festival’s debate on cartooning and free expression.
He has delivered workshops and speaker sessions at academic institutions and conferences — for example, a political-cartoon workshop at the International Centre Goa annual conference (St. Xavier’s College newsletter, July 2024).
Media appearances
* NDTV – The Big Fight (1 October 2021): Sandeep Adhwaryu appeared on NDTV's prime-time debate show The Big Fight, hosted by Sanket Upadhyay, discussing the role of political cartoons in contemporary media and the challenges faced by cartoonists in expressing satire amidst political sensitivities.
* Mojo Story (Barkha Dutt’s YouTube Channel, 2020): Adhwaryu appeared on an episode titled “As TV News Became a Joke, the Real Satire, Journalism and Laughs Came from These Men”, discussing the significance of political cartoons and the challenges faced by cartoonists in modern media.
Public controversies
In September 2023, Adhwaryu published a cartoon referencing a rape case in Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh, which drew criticism on social media for allegedly mocking Hindu sentiments. Following the controversy, Adhwaryu clarified that the cartoon represented his personal expression and was not officially published by The Times of India.
Workshops and exhibitions
Adhwaryu has participated in design and cartooning workshops across India. In 2024, he was a resource person at a visual communication workshop for students at St. Xavier’s College, Goa, hosted by The Times of India.
Personal life
Sandeep Adhwaryu lives in India and continues to contribute editorial cartoons to The Times of India. He is active on social media, where he shares his work and commentary on current events.
